equivalence.英释: If there is equivalence between two things, they have the same use, function, size, or value

alternative.英释: If one thing is an alternative to another, the first can be found, used, or done instead of the second

institution.中释: 社会公共机构；制度；设立，制定
institution.英释: a large organization that has a particular kind of work or purpose

philosopher.英释: someone who studies and develops ideas about the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil etc

scholarship.英释: an amount of money that is given to someone by an educational organization to help pay for their education

marginalize.英释: to make a person or a group of people unimportant and powerless in an unfair way

accommodate.英释: to provide someone with a place to stay, live, or work

sightseeing.英释: when you visit famous or interesting places, especially as tourists

installment.英释: one of a series of regular payments that you make until you have paid all the money you owe

personality.英释: someone’s character, especially the way they behave towards other people

headquarter.英释: to place in or establish as headquarters

consequence.英释: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

contaminate.英释: to make a place or substance dirty or harmful by putting something such as chemicals or poison in it

performance.英释: when someone performs a play or a piece of music

transaction.英释: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

subdivision.英释: when something is subdivided, or the parts that result from doing this

programming.中释: 〔计算机的〕程序编写，程序设计；程序；；〔电视或广播〕节目；电视[广播]节目策划，编排
programming.英释: the activity of writing programs for computers, or something written by a programmer

complacency.英释: a feeling of satisfaction with a situation or with what you have achieved, so that you stop trying to improve or change things – used to show disapproval

supervision.英释: when you supervise someone or something

application.英释: a formal, usually written, request for something such as a job, place at university, or permission to do something

inspiration.英释: a good idea about what you should do, write, say etc, especially one which you get suddenly

intelligent.中释: 有智慧的，聪明的，悟性强的
intelligent.英释: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

instruction.中释: 用法说明；操作指南；命令，指示
instruction.英释: the written information that tells you how to do or use something

considerate.英释: always thinking of what other people need or want and being careful not to upset them

superficial.英释: not studying or looking at something carefully and only seeing the most noticeable things

flexibility.英释: the ability to change or be changed easily to suit a different situation

standardize.英释: to make all the things of one particular type the same as each other

embarrassed.英释: feeling uncomfortable or nervous and worrying about what people think of you, for example because you have made a silly mistake, or because you have to talk or sing in public

sustainable.英释: able to continue without causing damage to the environment

distinctive.英释: having a special quality, character, or appearance that is different and easy to recognize

groundsheet.英释: a piece of material that water cannot pass through which people sleep on when they are camping

essentially.英释: used when stating the most basic facts about something

preventable.英释: Preventable diseases, illnesses, or deaths could be stopped from occurring

consumption.英释: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

participate.英释: to take part in an activity or event

expectation.英释: what you think or hope will happen

advancement.英释: progress or development in your job, level of knowledge etc

implication.英释: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

replacement.英释: when you get something that is newer or better than the one you had before

persistence.英释: determination to do something even though it is difficult or other people oppose it

influential.英释: having a lot of influence and therefore changing the way people think and behave

acknowledge.英释: to accept that someone or something has authority over people

complicated.英释: difficult to understand or deal with, because many parts or details are involved

restriction.英释: a rule or law that limits or controls what people can do

resourceful.英释: good at finding ways of dealing with practical problems

promotional.英释: Promotional material, events, or ideas are designed to increase the sales of a product or service

manufacture.英释: to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts

responsible.英释: if someone is responsible for an accident, mistake, crime etc, it is their fault or they can be blamed

fascination.英释: something that interests you very much, or the quality of being very interesting

investigate.英释: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

destruction.英释: the act or process of destroying something or of being destroyed

impermanent.中释: 非永久（性）的；不持久的，暂时的

significant.英释: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

showmanship.英释: skill at entertaining people and getting public attention

reservation.英释: an arrangement which you make so that a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc is kept for you at a particular time in the future

demonstrate.英释: to show or prove something clearly

indifferent.英释: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

appointment.英释: an arrangement for a meeting at an agreed time and place, for a particular purpose

foreseeable.英释: for as long as it is possible to know what is likely to happen

perspective.英释: a way of thinking about something, especially one which is influenced by the type of person you are or by your experiences

distinguish.英释: to recognize and understand the difference between two or more things or people

everlasting.英释: continuing for ever, even after someone has died

combination.英释: two or more different things that exist together or are used or put together

malfunction.英释: a fault in the way a machine or part of someone’s body works

spontaneous.英释: something that is spontaneous has not been planned or organized, but happens by itself, or because you suddenly feel you want to do it

distraction.英释: something that stops you paying attention to what you are doing

fashionable.英释: popular, especially for a short period of time

independent.中释: 独立的， 自主的； 无偏见的； 不相关联的
independent.英释: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

provocation.中释: 激怒， 刺激； 挑衅， 挑拨
provocation.英释: an action or event that makes someone angry or upset, or is intended to do this

preposition.英释: a word that is used before a noun,  pronoun  , or  gerund  to show place, time, direction etc. In the phrase ‘the trees in the park’, ‘in’ is a preposition.

concentrate.英释: a substance or liquid which has been made stronger by removing most of the water from it

translation.中释: 翻译； 译文， 译本
translation.英释: when you translate something, or something that has been translated

considering.中释: 鉴于， 考虑到， 顾及
considering.英释: used to say that you are thinking about a particular fact when you are giving your opinion

corporation.中释: 公司， 企业， 社团
corporation.英释: a big company, or a group of companies acting together as a single organization

integration.英释: the combining of two or more things so that they work together effectively

magnificent.中释: 宏伟的， 壮丽的； 华丽的； 极好的

conjunction.中释: 接合， 连接， 联合； 连词
conjunction.英释: a combination of different things that have come together by chance

accordingly.中释: 因此， 所以； 照着

possibility.英释: if there is a possibility that something is true or that something will happen, it might be true or it might happen

maintenance.中释: 维持； 保养； 抚养费
maintenance.英释: the repairs, painting etc that are necessary to keep something in good condition

legislation.中释: 法律， 法规； 立法， 法律的制定
legislation.英释: a law or set of laws

declaration.中释: 宣布， 宣告； 宣言， 声明； 申报
declaration.英释: an important official statement about a particular situation or plan, or the act of making this statement

agriculture.英释: the practice or science of farming

pessimistic.英释: expecting that bad things will happen in the future or that something will have a bad result

mathematics.英释: the science of numbers and of shapes, including  algebra  ,  geometry  , and  arithmetic

interaction.英释: a process by which two or more things affect each other

predictable.英释: if something or someone is predictable, you know what will happen or what they will do – sometimes used to show disapproval

opportunity.英释: a chance to do something or an occasion when it is easy for you to do something

transparent.中释: 透明的； 易识破的； 明显的， 清楚的
transparent.英释: if something is transparent, you can see through it

acquisition.中释: 取得， 获得， 习得； 获得物， 增添的人
acquisition.英释: the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill

operational.中释: 运转的； 可使用的； 操作上的
operational.英释: working and ready to be used

spectacular.中释: 壮观的演出； 惊人之举
spectacular.英释: an event or performance that is very large and impressive

underground.英释: a railway system under the ground

practically.中释: 几乎， 简直； 实际上
practically.英释: Practically means almost, but not completely or exactly

recognition.中释: 认出， 识别； 承认； 赏识， 表彰， 报偿
recognition.英释: the act of realizing and accepting that something is true or important

arrangement.中释: 整理， 排列， 安排； 准备工作
arrangement.英释: plans and preparations that you must make so that something can happen

certificate.中释: 证书， 证件， 执照
certificate.英释: an official document that states that a fact or facts are true

circulation.中释: 循环； 流传； 发行， 流通
circulation.英释: the movement of blood around your body

shortcoming.英释: a fault or weakness that makes someone or something less successful or effective than they should be

association.中释: 协会， 团体； 联合， 交往
association.英释: an organization that consists of a group of people who have the same aims, do the same kind of work etc

approximate.英释: to be close to a particular number

achievement.中释: 完成； 成就， 成绩
achievement.英释: something important that you succeed in doing by your own efforts

preparation.中释: 准备， 预备； 制剂
preparation.英释: the process of preparing something or preparing for something

preliminary.中释: 初步做法， 起始行为

imagination.中释: 想象， 想象力， 空想； 想象出
imagination.英释: the ability to form pictures or ideas in your mind

fascinating.中释: 迷人的， 有极大吸引力的

criminology.英释: the scientific study of crime and criminals

controversy.英释: a serious argument about something that involves many people and continues for a long time

handwriting.中释: 笔迹， 手迹； 书法

nationality.英释: the state of being legally a citizen of a particular country

appropriate.英释: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose

immediately.中释: 立即， 马上； 直接地， 紧接地

measurement.中释: 衡量， 测量； 尺寸， 大小
measurement.英释: the length, height etc of something

anniversary.英释: a date on which something special or important happened in a previous year

communicate.中释: 通讯； 交际， 交流； 连接， 相通； 传达， 传播； 传染
communicate.英释: to express your thoughts and feelings clearly, so that other people understand them

improvement.中释: 改进， 改善； 改进处
improvement.英释: the act of improving something or the state of being improved

environment.中释: 环境， 外界； 围绕
environment.英释: the air, water, and land on Earth, which is affected by man’s activities

progressive.中释: 前进的； 渐进的； 进行式的
progressive.英释: supporting new or modern ideas and methods, especially in politics and education

requirement.中释: 要求； 必要条件； 需要， 需要的东西
requirement.英释: something that someone needs or asks for

engineering.英释: the work involved in designing and building roads, bridges, machines etc

furthermore.英释: in addition to what has already been said

electricity.英释: the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc

distinction.中释: 差别， 不同， 区分
distinction.英释: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

remonstrate.英释: to tell someone that you strongly disapprove of something they have said or done

necessarily.英释: in a way that cannot be different or be avoided

competitive.中释: 竞争的， 比赛的； 好竞争的， 求胜心切的； 有竞争力的
competitive.英释: determined or trying very hard to be more successful than other people or businesses

outstanding.中释: 突出的， 杰出的； 未解决的； 未偿付的

consultancy.英释: a company that gives advice on a particular subject

homogeneous.中释: 同种类的， 同性质的， 有相同特征的
homogeneous.英释: Homogeneous is used to describe a group or thing which has members or parts that are all the same

troublesome.中释: 令人烦恼的， 麻烦的
troublesome.英释: causing problems, in an annoying way

publication.中释: 出版， 发行； 公布， 发表
publication.英释: The publication of a book or magazine is the act of printing it and sending it to stores to be sold

thermometer.英释: a piece of equipment that measures the temperature of the air, of your body etc

convenience.英释: the quality of being suitable or useful for a particular purpose, especially by making something easier or saving you time

accountancy.英释: the profession or work of keeping or checking financial accounts, calculating taxes etc

destination.中释: 目的地， 终点， 目标
destination.英释: the place that someone or something is going to

comparative.英释: comfort freedom, wealth etc that is quite good when compared to how comfortable, free, or rich etc something or someone else is

competition.英释: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

surrounding.英释: near or around a particular place

sympathetic.中释: 同情的； 和谐的； 赞同的， 支持的； 合意的
sympathetic.英释: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

observation.中释: 注意， 观察； 言论， 评论； 观察资料
observation.英释: the process of watching something or someone carefully for a period of time

theoretical.英释: relating to the study of ideas, especially scientific ideas, rather than with practical uses of the ideas or practical experience

interpreter.英释: someone who changes spoken words from one language into another, especially as their job

masterpiece.英释: a work of art, a piece of writing or music etc that is of very high quality or that is the best that a particular artist, writer etc has produced

composition.英释: the way in which something is made up of different parts, things, or members

development.英释: the process of gradually becoming bigger, better, stronger, or more advanced

electronics.英释: the study or industry of making equipment, such as computers and televisions, that work electronically

calculation.英释: the act or process of using numbers to find out an amount

intentional.英释: done deliberately and usually intended to cause harm

unconscious.英释: unable to see, move, feel etc in the normal way because you are not conscious

radioactive.英释: a radioactive substance is dangerous because it contains  radiation

description.英释: a piece of writing or speech that gives details about what someone or something is like

comfortable.英释: making you feel physically relaxed, without any pain or without being too hot, cold etc

loudspeaker.英释: a piece of equipment used to make sounds louder

elimination.英释: to remove or get rid of sth/sb

inexpensive.英释: cheap – use this to show approval

statistical.英释: relating to the use of statistics

grandfather.英释: the father of your father or mother

grandmother.英释: the mother of your mother or father

explanation.英释: a statement, fact, or situation that tells you why sth happened; a reason given for sth

information.英释: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc

interesting.英释: attracting your attention because it is special, exciting or unusual

exclusively.英释: to refer to situations or activities that involve only the thing or things mentioned, and nothing else

countryside.英释: land that is outside cities and towns

inefficient.英释: not using time, money, energy etc in the best way

probability.英释: how likely something is, sometimes calculated in a mathematical way

transformer.英释: a piece of equipment for changing electricity from one  voltage  to another

reliability.英释: the trait of being dependable or reliable

materialism.英释: the belief that only physical things really exist

examination.英释: a spoken or written test of knowledge, especially an important one
